Recap

  • Rotational kinetic energy is
  • is moment of intertia:

  • Total kinetic energy is rotational plus linear energy

Moment of inertia

  • Varies with axis of rotation
  • For continuous objects
  • In integrals mass per unit length is a good trick
    • Thus, rod rotating around an end has moment of inertia .
  • Regular shapes, all in form :
    • Hollow cylinder along axis:
    • Solid rod along perpendicular:
    • Thin sphere along diameter:
    • Solid sphere:
    • (2 more)

Sliding along incline

  • All objects have the same speed if not rolling
  • Velocity at bottom is , no dependance on mass without friction
  • Rolls without slipping:
    • Increasing lowers fraction.
    • For fixed greater results in more rotational energy
